page.title: 15KING GEORGE DOCK, HULL
page.content: Hull's largest deep water dock. This dock and its extension, Queen Elizabeth Dock are used by ocean going liners and large freighters. The dock has recently been modernised at a cost of Â£15 million and now provides new, deeper berths and a range of modern cranes, transit sheds and new roads. Unfortunately, business in the dock, and the port as a whole, has declined The{Unions}have refused to work as the owners wanted and the{Owners}have charged the customers high fees. The {Customers}have taken their business to non union inland berths. Most ot the remaining business is handling goods transported in containers, North Sea Ferries and the bulk handling of grain. None of these employ much of the dock's capabilities or labour force.Thus the dock stands largely empty.
